zone.line: Then two dreams came. One I remember not.
But in the other, his pale, wound-worn limbs
Fell from Prometheus, & the azure night
Grew radiant with the glory of that form
Which lives unchanged within, & his voice fell
Like music which makes dizzy the dim brain
Faint with intoxication of keen joy:
`Sister of her whose footsteps pave the world
more
With loveliness—thysel fair than aught but her
Whose shadow thou art—lift thine eyes on me!
I lifted them — the overpowering light
Of that immortal shape was shadowed oer
By love; which, from his soft & flowing limbs
And passion-parted lips, & keen faint eyes
Steam'd forth like vaporous fire; an atmosphere
Which wrapt me in its all-dissolving power
As the warm ether of the morning sun
Wraps ere it drinks some cloud of wandering
dew.
I saw not—heard not—moved not—only felt
His presence flow & mingle thro my blood
Till it became his life & his grew mine
